intro: Eriogonum brevicaule var. leptothecum, commonly known as the slender-leaved buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, papery bracts that enclose its flowers, which are usually white or pale pink in color. This variety is notable for its compact growth form and is often found in chaparral and grassland ecosystems.
